name: 30 Minute Creamy Thai Turmeric Chicken and Noodles.
description: The perfect weeknight dinner thatâ€™s made in 30 minutes, hearty, and pretty healthy too!

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cubed
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cubed

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce or tamari
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce or tamari

recipe_ingredient.note: 3 tablespoons sesame oil or extra virgin olive oil
recipe_ingredient.display: 3 tablespoons sesame oil or extra virgin olive oil

recipe_ingredient.note: 4 baby bok choy or 1 bunch kale, chopped
recipe_ingredient.display: 4 baby bok choy or 1 bunch kale, chopped

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 inch fresh ginger, peeled and grated
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 inch fresh ginger, peeled and grated

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/4 cup fresh cilantro and or Thai basil, chopped
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/4 cup fresh cilantro and or Thai basil, chopped

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/4 cup Thai red curry paste, using more or less to taste
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/4 cup Thai red curry paste, using more or less to taste

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 tablespoons fish sauce (or low sodium soy sauce)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 tablespoons fish sauce (or low sodium soy sauce)

recipe_ingredient.note: 8 ounces rice noodles, thick or thin
recipe_ingredient.display: 8 ounces rice noodles, thick or thin

recipe_ingredient.note: sliced limes, mixed herbs, and thinly sliced shallots, for serving
recipe_ingredient.display: sliced limes, mixed herbs, and thinly sliced shallots, for serving

recipe_instructions.text: Toss the chicken with turmeric, ground ginger, pinch of pepper, soy sauce, honey, and 1 tablespoon oil. Let sit 5 minutes.

Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven or braiser over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and sear until browned, about 3 minutes, stirring 2-3 times. Toss in the bok choy and cook 2 minutes more, until just charred on the edges. Transfer everything to a plate.

To the same Dutch oven, add 2 tablespoons oil, the shallots, garlic, fresh ginger, and cilantro/basil, cook 3 minutes, then stir in the curry paste. Cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in about 2 cups coconut milk and fish sauce. Slide the chicken and bok choy back into the sauce. If you want more sauce, add the additional coconut milk...I always use 3 cups. Simmer over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly, 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook noodles according to package directions.
Divide the noodles between bowls and ladle the chicken and sauce over. Top each bowl as desired with herbs, shallots, and lime juice.
